00134     class continue_receiver : public receiver< continue_msg > {
00135     public:
00136 
00138         typedef continue_msg input_type;
00139 
00141         typedef sender< continue_msg > predecessor_type;
00142 
00144         continue_receiver( int number_of_predecessors = 0 ) { 
00145             my_predecessor_count = number_of_predecessors;
00146             my_current_count = 0;
00147         }
00148 
00150         virtual ~continue_receiver() { }
00151 
00153         /* override */ bool register_predecessor( predecessor_type & ) {
00154             spin_mutex::scoped_lock l(my_mutex);
00155             ++my_predecessor_count;
00156             return true;
00157         }
00158 
00160 
00163         /* override */ bool remove_predecessor( predecessor_type & ) {
00164             spin_mutex::scoped_lock l(my_mutex);
00165             --my_predecessor_count;
00166             return true;
00167         }
00168 
00170 
00172         /* override */ bool try_put( input_type ) {
00173             {
00174                 spin_mutex::scoped_lock l(my_mutex);
00175                 if ( ++my_current_count < my_predecessor_count ) 
00176                     return true;
00177                 else
00178                     my_current_count = 0;
00179             }
00180             execute();
00181             return true;
00182         }
00183 
00184     protected:
00185 
00186         spin_mutex my_mutex;
00187         int my_predecessor_count;
00188         int my_current_count;
00189 
00191 
00193         virtual void execute() = 0;
00194 
00195     };

00338         template< typename T, typename M=spin_mutex >
00339         class node_cache {
00340             public:
00341 
00342             typedef size_t size_type;
00343 
00344             bool empty() {
00345                 typename my_mutex_type::scoped_lock lock( my_mutex );
00346                 return internal_empty();
00347             }
00348 
00349             void add( T &n ) {
00350                 typename my_mutex_type::scoped_lock lock( my_mutex );
00351                 internal_push(n);
00352             }
00353 
00354             void remove( T &n ) {
00355                 typename my_mutex_type::scoped_lock lock( my_mutex );
00356                 for ( size_t i = internal_size(); i != 0; --i ) {
00357                     T &s = internal_pop();
00358                     if ( &s != &n ) {
00359                         internal_push(s);
00360                     }
00361                 }
00362             }
00363 
00364         protected:
00365 
00366             typedef M my_mutex_type;
00367             my_mutex_type my_mutex;
00368             std::queue< T * > my_q;
00369 
00370             // Assumes lock is held
00371             inline bool internal_empty( )  {
00372                 return my_q.empty();
00373             }
00374 
00375             // Assumes lock is held
00376             inline size_type internal_size( )  {
00377                 return my_q.size(); 
00378             }
00379 
00380             // Assumes lock is held
00381             inline void internal_push( T &n )  {
00382                 my_q.push(&n);
00383             }
00384 
00385             // Assumes lock is held
00386             inline T &internal_pop() {
00387                 T *v = my_q.front();
00388                 my_q.pop();
00389                 return *v;
00390             }
00391 
00392         };

00395         template< typename T, typename M=spin_mutex >
00396         class predecessor_cache : public node_cache< sender<T>, M > {
00397             public:
00398             typedef M my_mutex_type;
00399             typedef T output_type; 
00400             typedef sender<output_type> predecessor_type;
00401             typedef receiver<output_type> successor_type;
00402 
00403             predecessor_cache( ) : my_owner( NULL ) { }
00404 
00405             void set_owner( successor_type *owner ) { my_owner = owner; }
00406 
00407             bool get_item( output_type &v ) {
00408 
00409                 bool msg = false;
00410 
00411                 do {
00412                     predecessor_type *src;
00413                     {
00414                         typename my_mutex_type::scoped_lock lock(this->my_mutex);
00415                         if ( this->internal_empty() ) {
00416                             break;
00417                         }
00418                         src = &this->internal_pop();
00419                     }
00420 
00421                     // Try to get from this sender
00422                     msg = src->try_get( v );
00423 
00424                     if (msg == false) {
00425                         // Relinquish ownership of the edge
00426                         if ( my_owner) 
00427                             src->register_successor( *my_owner );
00428                     } else {
00429                         // Retain ownership of the edge
00430                         this->add(*src);
00431                     }
00432                 } while ( msg == false );
00433                 return msg;
00434             }
00435 
00436         protected:
00437             successor_type *my_owner;
00438         };
00439 
00441         template< typename T, typename M=spin_mutex >
00442         class reservable_predecessor_cache : public predecessor_cache< T, M > {
00443         public:
00444             typedef M my_mutex_type;
00445             typedef T output_type; 
00446             typedef sender<T> predecessor_type;
00447             typedef receiver<T> successor_type;
00448 
00449             reservable_predecessor_cache( ) : reserved_src(NULL) { }
00450 
00451             bool 
00452             try_reserve( output_type &v ) {
00453                 bool msg = false;
00454 
00455                 do {
00456                     {
00457                         typename my_mutex_type::scoped_lock lock(this->my_mutex);
00458                         if ( reserved_src || this->internal_empty() ) 
00459                             return false;
00460 
00461                         reserved_src = &this->internal_pop();
00462                     }
00463 
00464                     // Try to get from this sender
00465                     msg = reserved_src->try_reserve( v );
00466 
00467                     if (msg == false) {
00468                         typename my_mutex_type::scoped_lock lock(this->my_mutex);
00469                         // Relinquish ownership of the edge
00470                         reserved_src->register_successor( *this->my_owner );
00471                         reserved_src = NULL;
00472                     } else {
00473                         // Retain ownership of the edge
00474                         this->add( *reserved_src );
00475                     }
00476                 } while ( msg == false );
00477 
00478                 return msg;
00479             }
00480 
00481             bool 
00482             try_release( ) {
00483                 reserved_src->try_release( );
00484                 reserved_src = NULL;
00485                 return true;
00486             }
00487 
00488             bool 
00489             try_consume( ) {
00490                 reserved_src->try_consume( );
00491                 reserved_src = NULL;
00492                 return true;
00493             }
00494 
00495         private:
00496             predecessor_type *reserved_src;
00497         };

00501         template<typename T, typename M=spin_rw_mutex >
00502         class successor_cache : no_copy {
00503         protected:
00504 
00505             typedef M my_mutex_type;
00506             my_mutex_type my_mutex;
00507 
00508             typedef std::list< receiver<T> * > my_successors_type;
00509             my_successors_type my_successors;
00510 
00511             sender<T> *my_owner;
00512 
00513         public:
00514 
00515             successor_cache( ) : my_owner(NULL) {}
00516 
00517             void set_owner( sender<T> *owner ) { my_owner = owner; }
00518 
00519             virtual ~successor_cache() {}
00520 
00521             void register_successor( receiver<T> &r ) {
00522                 typename my_mutex_type::scoped_lock l(my_mutex, true);
00523                 my_successors.push_back( &r ); 
00524             }
00525 
00526             void remove_successor( receiver<T> &r ) {
00527                 typename my_mutex_type::scoped_lock l(my_mutex, true);
00528                 for ( typename my_successors_type::iterator i = my_successors.begin();
00529                       i != my_successors.end(); ++i ) { 
00530                     if ( *i == & r ) { 
00531                         my_successors.erase(i);
00532                         break;
00533                     }
00534                 }
00535             }
00536 
00537             bool empty() { 
00538                 typename my_mutex_type::scoped_lock l(my_mutex, false);
00539                 return my_successors.empty(); 
00540             }
00541 
00542             virtual bool try_put( T t ) = 0; 
00543          };
00544 
00546         template<>
00547         class successor_cache< continue_msg > : no_copy {
00548         protected:
00549 
00550             typedef spin_rw_mutex my_mutex_type;
00551             my_mutex_type my_mutex;
00552 
00553             typedef std::list< receiver<continue_msg> * > my_successors_type;
00554             my_successors_type my_successors;
00555 
00556             sender<continue_msg> *my_owner;
00557 
00558         public:
00559 
00560             successor_cache( ) : my_owner(NULL) {}
00561 
00562             void set_owner( sender<continue_msg> *owner ) { my_owner = owner; }
00563 
00564             virtual ~successor_cache() {}
00565 
00566             void register_successor( receiver<continue_msg> &r ) {
00567                 my_mutex_type::scoped_lock l(my_mutex, true);
00568                 my_successors.push_back( &r ); 
00569                 if ( my_owner )
00570                     r.register_predecessor( *my_owner );
00571             }
00572 
00573             void remove_successor( receiver<continue_msg> &r ) {
00574                 my_mutex_type::scoped_lock l(my_mutex, true);
00575                 for ( my_successors_type::iterator i = my_successors.begin();
00576                       i != my_successors.end(); ++i ) { 
00577                     if ( *i == & r ) { 
00578                         if ( my_owner )
00579                             r.remove_predecessor( *my_owner );
00580                         my_successors.erase(i);
00581                         break;
00582                     }
00583                 }
00584             }
00585 
00586             bool empty() { 
00587                 my_mutex_type::scoped_lock l(my_mutex, false);
00588                 return my_successors.empty(); 
00589             }
00590 
00591             virtual bool try_put( continue_msg t ) = 0; 
00592 
00593          };

00596         template<typename T, typename M=spin_rw_mutex>
00597         class broadcast_cache : public successor_cache<T, M> {
00598             typedef M my_mutex_type;
00599             typedef std::list< receiver<T> * > my_successors_type;
00600 
00601         public:
00602 
00603             broadcast_cache( ) {}
00604 
00605             bool try_put( T t ) {
00606                 bool msg = false;
00607                 bool upgraded = false;
00608                 typename my_mutex_type::scoped_lock l(this->my_mutex, false);
00609                 typename my_successors_type::iterator i = this->my_successors.begin();
00610                 while ( i != this->my_successors.end() ) {
00611                    if ( (*i)->try_put( t ) == true ) {
00612                        ++i;
00613                        msg = true;
00614                    } else {
00615                       if ( (*i)->register_predecessor(*this->my_owner) ) {
00616                           if (!upgraded) {
00617                               l.upgrade_to_writer();
00618                               upgraded = true;
00619                           }
00620                           i = this->my_successors.erase(i);
00621                       }
00622                       else {
00623                           ++i;
00624                       }
00625                    }
00626                 }
00627                 return msg;
00628             }
00629         };
00630 
00632         template<typename T, typename M=spin_rw_mutex >
00633         class round_robin_cache : public successor_cache<T, M> {
00634             typedef size_t size_type;
00635             typedef M my_mutex_type;
00636             typedef std::list< receiver<T> * > my_successors_type;
00637 
00638         public:
00639 
00640             round_robin_cache( ) {}
00641 
00642             size_type size() {
00643                 typename my_mutex_type::scoped_lock l(this->my_mutex, false);
00644                 return this->my_successors.size();
00645             }
00646 
00647             bool try_put( T t ) {
00648                 bool upgraded = false;
00649                 typename my_mutex_type::scoped_lock l(this->my_mutex, false);
00650                 typename my_successors_type::iterator i = this->my_successors.begin();
00651                 while ( i != this->my_successors.end() ) {
00652                    if ( (*i)->try_put( t ) ) {
00653                        return true;
00654                    } else {
00655                       if ( (*i)->register_predecessor(*this->my_owner) ) {
00656                           if (!upgraded) {
00657                               l.upgrade_to_writer();
00658                               upgraded = true;
00659                           }
00660                           i = this->my_successors.erase(i);
00661                       }
00662                       else {
00663                           ++i;
00664                       }
00665                    }
00666                 }
00667                 return false;
00668             }
00669         };

00696         template< typename Body >
00697         class run_task : public task {
00698         public: 
00699             run_task( Body& body ) : my_body(body) {}
00700             task *execute() {
00701                 my_body();
00702                 return NULL;
00703             }
00704         private:
00705             Body my_body;
00706         };
00707 
00708         template< typename Receiver, typename Body >
00709         class run_and_put_task : public task {
00710         public: 
00711             run_and_put_task( Receiver &r, Body& body ) : my_receiver(r), my_body(body) {}
00712             task *execute() {
00713                 my_receiver.try_put( my_body() );
00714                 return NULL;
00715             }
00716         private:
00717             Receiver &my_receiver;
00718             Body my_body;
00719         };
00720 
00721     public:
00722 
00724         enum concurrency { unlimited = 0, serial = 1 };
00725 
00727         graph() : my_root_task( new ( task::allocate_root( ) ) empty_task ) {
00728             my_root_task->set_ref_count(1);
00729         }
00730 
00732 
00734         ~graph() {
00735             wait_for_all();
00736             my_root_task->set_ref_count(0);
00737             task::destroy( *my_root_task );
00738         }
00739 
00740 
00742 
00744         void increment_wait_count() { 
00745             if (my_root_task)
00746                 my_root_task->increment_ref_count();
00747         }
00748 
00750 
00752         void decrement_wait_count() { 
00753             if (my_root_task)
00754                 my_root_task->decrement_ref_count(); 
00755         }
00756 
00758 
00760         template< typename Receiver, typename Body >
00761             void run( Receiver &r, Body body ) {
00762            task::enqueue( * new ( task::allocate_additional_child_of( *my_root_task ) ) 
00763                run_and_put_task< Receiver, Body >( r, body ) );
00764         }
00765 
00767 
00769         template< typename Body >
00770         void run( Body body ) {
00771            task::enqueue( * new ( task::allocate_additional_child_of( *my_root_task ) ) 
00772                run_task< Body >( body ) );
00773         }
00774 
00776 
00777         void wait_for_all() {
00778             if (my_root_task)
00779                 my_root_task->wait_for_all();
00780             my_root_task->set_ref_count(1);
00781         }
00782 
00784         task * root_task() {
00785             return my_root_task;
00786         }
00787 
00788     private:
00789 
00790         task *my_root_task;
00791 
00792     };

00799         template< typename Input, typename Output >
00800         class function_input : public receiver<Input>, no_assign {
00801             typedef sender<Input> predecessor_type;
00802             enum op_stat {WAIT=0, SUCCEEDED, FAILED};
00803             enum op_type {reg_pred, rem_pred, app_body, tryput, try_fwd};
00804             typedef function_input<Input, Output> my_class;
00805 
00806         public:
00808             typedef Input input_type;
00810             typedef Output output_type;
00811 
00813             template< typename Body >
00814             function_input( graph &g, size_t max_concurrency, Body& body )
00815                 : my_root_task(g.root_task()), my_max_concurrency(max_concurrency), my_concurrency(internal::node_state_idle),
00816                   my_body( new internal::function_body_leaf< input_type, output_type, Body>(body) ),
00817                 forwarder_busy(false) {
00818                 my_predecessors.set_owner(this);
00819                 my_aggregator.initialize_handler(my_handler(this));
00820             }
00821 
00823             virtual ~function_input() { delete my_body; }
00824 
00826             virtual bool try_put( input_type t ) {
00827                if ( my_max_concurrency == 0 ) {
00828                    spawn_body_task( t );
00829                    return true;
00830                } else {
00831                    my_operation op_data(t, tryput);
00832                    my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
00833                    return op_data.status == SUCCEEDED;
00834                }
00835             }
00836 
00838             /* override */ bool register_predecessor( predecessor_type &src ) {
00839                 my_operation op_data(reg_pred);
00840                 op_data.r = &src;
00841                 my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
00842                 return true;
00843             }
00844 
00846             /* override */ bool remove_predecessor( predecessor_type &src ) {
00847                 my_operation op_data(rem_pred);
00848                 op_data.r = &src;
00849                 my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
00850                 return true;
00851             }
00852 
00853         protected:
00854             task *my_root_task;
00855             const size_t my_max_concurrency;
00856             size_t my_concurrency;
00857             function_body<input_type, output_type> *my_body;
00858             predecessor_cache<input_type, null_mutex > my_predecessors;
00859 
00860             virtual broadcast_cache<output_type > &successors() = 0;
00861 
00862         private:
00863             friend class apply_body_task< function_input< input_type, output_type >, input_type >;
00864             friend class forward_task< function_input< input_type, output_type > >;
00865 
00866             class my_operation : public aggregated_operation< my_operation > {
00867             public:
00868                 char type;
00869                 union {
00870                     input_type *elem;
00871                     predecessor_type *r;
00872                 };
00873                 my_operation(const input_type& e, op_type t) :
00874                     type(char(t)), elem(const_cast<input_type*>(&e)) {}
00875                 my_operation(op_type t) : type(char(t)), r(NULL) {}
00876             };
00877 
00878             bool forwarder_busy;
00879             typedef internal::aggregating_functor<my_class, my_operation> my_handler;
00880             friend class internal::aggregating_functor<my_class, my_operation>;
00881             aggregator< my_handler, my_operation > my_aggregator;
00882 
00883             void handle_operations(my_operation *op_list) {
00884                 my_operation *tmp;
00885                 while (op_list) {
00886                     tmp = op_list;
00887                     op_list = op_list->next;
00888                     switch (tmp->type) {
00889                     case reg_pred:
00890                         my_predecessors.add(*(tmp->r));
00891                         __TBB_store_with_release(tmp->status, SUCCEEDED);
00892                         if (!forwarder_busy) {
00893                             forwarder_busy = true;
00894                             spawn_forward_task();
00895                         }
00896                         break;
00897                     case rem_pred:
00898                         my_predecessors.remove(*(tmp->r));
00899                         __TBB_store_with_release(tmp->status, SUCCEEDED);
00900                         break;
00901                     case app_body:
00902                         __TBB_ASSERT(my_max_concurrency != 0, NULL);
00903                         --my_concurrency;
00904                         __TBB_store_with_release(tmp->status, SUCCEEDED);
00905                         if (my_concurrency<my_max_concurrency) {
00906                             input_type i;
00907                             if (my_predecessors.get_item(i)) {
00908                                 ++my_concurrency;
00909                                 spawn_body_task(i);
00910                             }
00911                         }
00912                         break;
00913                     case tryput: internal_try_put(tmp);  break;
00914                     case try_fwd: internal_forward(tmp);  break;
00915                     }
00916                 }
00917             }
00918 
00920             void internal_try_put(my_operation *op) {
00921                 __TBB_ASSERT(my_max_concurrency != 0, NULL);
00922                 if (my_concurrency < my_max_concurrency) {
00923                    ++my_concurrency;
00924                    spawn_body_task(*(op->elem));
00925                    __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
00926                } else {
00927                    __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, FAILED);
00928                }
00929             }
00930 
00932             void internal_forward(my_operation *op) {
00933                 if (my_concurrency<my_max_concurrency || !my_max_concurrency) {
00934                     input_type i;
00935                     if (my_predecessors.get_item(i)) {
00936                         ++my_concurrency;
00937                         __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
00938                         spawn_body_task(i);
00939                         return;
00940                     }
00941                 }
00942                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, FAILED);
00943                 forwarder_busy = false;
00944             }
00945 
00947             void apply_body( input_type &i ) {
00948                 successors().try_put( (*my_body)(i) );
00949                 if ( my_max_concurrency != 0 ) {
00950                     my_operation op_data(app_body);
00951                     my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
00952                 }
00953             }
00954 
00956            inline void spawn_body_task( input_type &input ) {
00957                task::enqueue(*new(task::allocate_additional_child_of(*my_root_task)) apply_body_task<function_input<input_type, output_type>, input_type >(*this, input));
00958            }
00959 
00961            void forward() {
00962                my_operation op_data(try_fwd);
00963                do {
00964                    op_data.status = WAIT;
00965                    my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
00966                } while (op_data.status == SUCCEEDED);
00967            }
00968 
00970            inline void spawn_forward_task() {
00971                task::enqueue(*new(task::allocate_additional_child_of(*my_root_task)) forward_task<function_input<input_type, output_type> >(*this));
00972            }
00973         };
00974 
00976         template< typename Output >
00977         class continue_input : public continue_receiver {
00978         public:
00979 
00981             typedef continue_msg input_type;
00982     
00984             typedef Output output_type;
00985 
00986             template< typename Body >
00987             continue_input( graph &g, Body& body )
00988                 : my_root_task(g.root_task()), 
00989                  my_body( new internal::function_body_leaf< input_type, output_type, Body>(body) ) { }
00990 
00991             template< typename Body >
00992             continue_input( graph &g, int number_of_predecessors, Body& body )
00993                 : continue_receiver( number_of_predecessors ), my_root_task(g.root_task()), 
00994                  my_body( new internal::function_body_leaf< input_type, output_type, Body>(body) ) { }
00995 
00996         protected:
00997 
00998             task *my_root_task;
00999             function_body<input_type, output_type> *my_body;
01000 
01001             virtual broadcast_cache<output_type > &successors() = 0; 
01002 
01003             friend class apply_body_task< continue_input< Output >, continue_msg >;
01004 
01006             /* override */ void apply_body( input_type ) {
01007                 successors().try_put( (*my_body)( continue_msg() ) );
01008             }
01009 
01011             /* override */ void execute( ) {
01012                 task::enqueue( * new ( task::allocate_additional_child_of( *my_root_task ) ) 
01013                    apply_body_task< continue_input< Output >, continue_msg >( *this, continue_msg() ) ); 
01014             }
01015         };
01016 
01018         template< typename Output >
01019         class function_output : public sender<Output> {
01020         public:
01021 
01022             typedef Output output_type;
01023 
01024             function_output() { }
01025 
01027             /* override */ bool register_successor( receiver<output_type> &r ) {
01028                 successors().register_successor( r );
01029                 return true;
01030             }
01031 
01033             /* override */ bool remove_successor( receiver<output_type> &r ) {
01034                 successors().remove_successor( r );
01035                 return true;
01036             }
01037   
01038         protected:
01039 
01040             virtual broadcast_cache<output_type > &successors() = 0; 
01041 
01042         };
01043 
01044     }
01046 
01048     template < typename Output >
01049     class source_node : public graph_node, public sender< Output > {
01050     public:
01051 
01053         typedef Output output_type;           
01054 
01056         typedef receiver< Output > successor_type;
01057 
01059         template< typename Body >
01060         source_node( graph &g, Body body, bool is_active = true )
01061              : my_root_task(g.root_task()), my_state( is_active ? internal::node_state_idle : internal::node_state_inactive ),
01062               my_body( new internal::source_body_leaf< output_type, Body>(body) ),
01063               my_reserved(false), my_has_cached_item(false) { 
01064             my_successors.set_owner(this);
01065         }
01066 
01068         ~source_node() { delete my_body; }
01069 
01071         /* override */ bool register_successor( receiver<output_type> &r ) {
01072             spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(my_mutex);
01073             my_successors.register_successor(r);
01074             if ( my_state != internal::node_state_inactive )
01075                 spawn_put();
01076             return true;
01077         }
01078 
01080         /* override */ bool remove_successor( receiver<output_type> &r ) {
01081             spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(my_mutex);
01082             my_successors.remove_successor(r);
01083             return true;
01084         }
01085 
01087         /*override */ bool try_get( output_type &v ) {
01088             spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(my_mutex);
01089             if ( my_reserved )  
01090                 return false;
01091 
01092             if ( my_has_cached_item ) {
01093                 v = my_cached_item;
01094                 my_has_cached_item = false;
01095             } else if ( (*my_body)(v) == false ) {
01096                 return false;
01097             }
01098             return true;
01099         }
01100 
01102         /* override */ bool try_reserve( output_type &v ) {
01103             spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(my_mutex);
01104             if ( my_reserved ) {
01105                 return false;
01106             }
01107 
01108             if ( !my_has_cached_item && (*my_body)(my_cached_item) )  
01109                 my_has_cached_item = true;
01110 
01111             if ( my_has_cached_item ) {
01112                 v = my_cached_item;
01113                 my_reserved = true;
01114                 return true;
01115             } else {
01116                 return false;
01117             }
01118         }
01119 
01121 
01122         /* override */ bool try_release( ) {
01123             spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(my_mutex);
01124             __TBB_ASSERT( my_reserved && my_has_cached_item, "releasing non-existent reservation" );
01125             my_reserved = false;
01126             spawn_put();
01127             return true;
01128         }
01129 
01131         /* override */ bool try_consume( ) {
01132             spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(my_mutex);
01133             __TBB_ASSERT( my_reserved && my_has_cached_item, "consuming non-existent reservation" );
01134             my_reserved = false;
01135             my_has_cached_item = false;
01136             if ( !my_successors.empty() ) {
01137                 spawn_put();
01138             }
01139             return true;
01140         }
01141 
01143         void activate() {
01144             spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(my_mutex);
01145             my_state = internal::node_state_idle;
01146             if ( !my_successors.empty() )
01147                 spawn_put();
01148         }
01149 
01150     private:
01151 
01152         task *my_root_task;
01153         spin_mutex my_mutex;
01154         internal::node_state my_state;
01155         internal::source_body<output_type> *my_body;
01156         internal::broadcast_cache< output_type > my_successors;
01157         bool my_reserved;
01158         bool my_has_cached_item;
01159         output_type my_cached_item;
01160 
01161         friend class internal::source_task< source_node< output_type > >;
01162 
01164         /* override */ void apply_body( ) {
01165             output_type v;
01166             if ( try_reserve(v) == false )
01167                 return;
01168 
01169             if ( my_successors.try_put( v ) ) 
01170                 try_consume();
01171             else
01172                 try_release();
01173         }
01174 
01176         /* override */ void spawn_put( ) {
01177             task::enqueue( * new ( task::allocate_additional_child_of( *my_root_task ) ) 
01178                internal::source_task< source_node< output_type > >( *this ) ); 
01179         }
01180 
01181     };
01182 
01184     template <typename Input, typename Output = continue_msg >
01185     class function_node : public graph_node, public internal::function_input<Input,Output>, public internal::function_output<Output> {
01186     public:
01187 
01188         typedef Input input_type;
01189         typedef Output output_type;
01190         typedef sender< input_type > predecessor_type;
01191         typedef receiver< output_type > successor_type;
01192 
01194         template< typename Body >
01195         function_node( graph &g, size_t concurrency, Body body )
01196         : internal::function_input<input_type,output_type>( g, concurrency, body ) {
01197             my_successors.set_owner(this);
01198         }
01199 
01200     protected:
01201 
01202         internal::broadcast_cache<output_type> my_successors; 
01203         /* override */ internal::broadcast_cache<output_type> &successors () { return my_successors; }
01204 
01205     };

01208     template <typename Output>
01209     class executable_node : public graph_node, public internal::continue_input<Output>, public internal::function_output<Output> {
01210     public:
01211 
01212         typedef continue_msg input_type;
01213         typedef Output output_type;
01214         typedef sender< input_type > predecessor_type;
01215         typedef receiver< output_type > successor_type;
01216 
01218          template <typename Body >
01219          executable_node( graph &g, Body body )
01220                  : internal::continue_input<output_type>( g, body ) {
01221              my_successors.set_owner(this);
01222          }
01223 
01225          template <typename Body >
01226          executable_node( graph &g, int number_of_predecessors, Body body )
01227                  : internal::continue_input<output_type>( g, number_of_predecessors, body ) {
01228              my_successors.set_owner(this);
01229          }
01230 
01231     protected:
01232 
01233         internal::broadcast_cache<output_type> my_successors; 
01234         /* override */ internal::broadcast_cache<output_type> &successors () { return my_successors; }
01235 
01236     };

01239 
01240     template< typename T >
01241     class overwrite_node : public graph_node, public receiver<T>, public sender<T>, internal::no_copy {
01242     public:
01243 
01244         typedef T input_type;
01245         typedef T output_type;
01246         typedef sender< input_type > predecessor_type;
01247         typedef receiver< output_type > successor_type;
01248 
01249         overwrite_node() : my_buffer_is_valid(false) {
01250             my_successors.set_owner( this );
01251         }
01252 
01253         ~overwrite_node() {}
01254 
01255         /* override */ bool register_successor( successor_type &s ) {
01256             spin_mutex::scoped_lock l( my_mutex );
01257             if ( my_buffer_is_valid ) {
01258                 // We have a valid value that must be forwarded immediately.
01259                 if ( s.try_put( my_buffer ) || !s.register_predecessor( *this  ) ) {
01260                     // We add the successor: it accepted our put or it rejected it but won't let use become a predecessor
01261                     my_successors.register_successor( s );
01262                     return true;
01263                 } else {
01264                     // We don't add the successor: it rejected our put and we became its predecessor instead
01265                     return false;
01266                 }
01267             } else {
01268                 // No valid value yet, just add as successor
01269                 my_successors.register_successor( s );
01270                 return true;
01271             }
01272         }
01273 
01274         /* override */ bool remove_successor( successor_type &s ) {
01275             spin_mutex::scoped_lock l( my_mutex );
01276             my_successors.remove_successor(s);
01277             return true;
01278         }
01279 
01280         /* override */ bool try_put( T v ) {
01281             spin_mutex::scoped_lock l( my_mutex );
01282             my_buffer = v;
01283             my_buffer_is_valid = true;
01284             my_successors.try_put(v);
01285             return true;
01286         }
01287 
01288         /* override */ bool try_get( T &v ) {
01289             spin_mutex::scoped_lock l( my_mutex );
01290             if ( my_buffer_is_valid ) {
01291                 v = my_buffer;
01292                 return true;
01293             } else {
01294                 return false;
01295             }
01296         }
01297 
01298         bool is_valid() {
01299            spin_mutex::scoped_lock l( my_mutex );
01300            return my_buffer_is_valid;
01301         }
01302 
01303         void clear() {
01304            spin_mutex::scoped_lock l( my_mutex );
01305            my_buffer_is_valid = false;
01306         }
01307 
01308     protected:
01309 
01310         spin_mutex my_mutex;
01311         internal::broadcast_cache< T, null_rw_mutex > my_successors;
01312         T my_buffer;
01313         bool my_buffer_is_valid;
01314 
01315     };
01316 
01317     template< typename T >
01318     class write_once_node : public overwrite_node<T> {
01319     public:
01320 
01321         typedef T input_type;
01322         typedef T output_type;
01323         typedef sender< input_type > predecessor_type;
01324         typedef receiver< output_type > successor_type;
01325 
01326         /* override */ bool try_put( T v ) {
01327             spin_mutex::scoped_lock l( this->my_mutex );
01328             if ( this->my_buffer_is_valid ) {
01329                 return false;
01330             } else {
01331                 this->my_buffer = v;
01332                 this->my_buffer_is_valid = true;
01333                 this->my_successors.try_put(v);
01334                 return true;
01335             }
01336         }
01337     };
