01341     class continue_node : public executable_node< continue_msg > { 
01342     public:
01343 
01344         typedef continue_msg input_type;
01345         typedef continue_msg output_type;
01346         typedef sender< input_type > predecessor_type;
01347         typedef receiver< output_type > successor_type;
01348 
01349         continue_node( graph &g ) : executable_node<continue_msg>( g, internal::empty_body< continue_msg, continue_msg>() ) {}
01350     };
01351 
01353     template <typename T>
01354     class broadcast_node : public graph_node, public receiver<T>, public sender<T>, internal::no_copy {
01355 
01356         internal::broadcast_cache<T> my_successors;
01357 
01358     public:
01359 
01360         typedef T input_type;
01361         typedef T output_type;
01362         typedef sender< input_type > predecessor_type;
01363         typedef receiver< output_type > successor_type;
01364 
01365         broadcast_node( ) {
01366            my_successors.set_owner( this ); 
01367         }
01368 
01370         virtual bool register_successor( receiver<T> &r ) {
01371             my_successors.register_successor( r );
01372             return true;
01373         }
01374 
01376         virtual bool remove_successor( receiver<T> &r ) {
01377             my_successors.remove_successor( r );
01378             return true;
01379         }
01380 
01381         /* override */ bool try_put( T t ) {
01382             my_successors.try_put(t);
01383             return true;
01384         }
01385 
01386     };
01387 
01388 #include "_item_buffer.h"
01389 
01391     template <typename T, typename A=cache_aligned_allocator<T> >
01392         class buffer_node : public graph_node, public reservable_item_buffer<T, A>, public receiver<T>, public sender<T>, internal::no_copy {
01393     public:
01394         typedef T input_type;
01395         typedef T output_type;
01396         typedef sender< input_type > predecessor_type;
01397         typedef receiver< output_type > successor_type;
01398         typedef buffer_node<T, A> my_class;
01399     protected:
01400         typedef size_t size_type;
01401         internal::round_robin_cache< T, null_rw_mutex > my_successors;
01402 
01403         task *my_parent;
01404 
01405         friend class internal::forward_task< buffer_node< T, A > >;
01406 
01407         enum op_type {reg_succ, rem_succ, req_item, res_item, rel_res, con_res, put_item, try_fwd};
01408         enum op_stat {WAIT=0, SUCCEEDED, FAILED};
01409 
01410         // implements the aggregator_operation concept
01411         class buffer_operation : public internal::aggregated_operation< buffer_operation > {
01412         public:
01413             char type;
01414             T *elem;
01415             successor_type *r;
01416             buffer_operation(const T& e, op_type t) :
01417                 type(char(t)), elem(const_cast<T*>(&e)), r(NULL) {}
01418             buffer_operation(op_type t) : type(char(t)), r(NULL) {}
01419         };
01420 
01421         bool forwarder_busy;
01422         typedef internal::aggregating_functor<my_class, buffer_operation> my_handler;
01423         friend class internal::aggregating_functor<my_class, buffer_operation>;
01424         internal::aggregator< my_handler, buffer_operation> my_aggregator;
01425 
01426         virtual void handle_operations(buffer_operation *op_list) {
01427             buffer_operation *tmp;
01428             bool try_forwarding=false;
01429             while (op_list) {
01430                 tmp = op_list;
01431                 op_list = op_list->next;
01432                 switch (tmp->type) {
01433                 case reg_succ: internal_reg_succ(tmp);  try_forwarding = true; break;
01434                 case rem_succ: internal_rem_succ(tmp); break;
01435                 case req_item: internal_pop(tmp); break;
01436                 case res_item: internal_reserve(tmp); break;
01437                 case rel_res:  internal_release(tmp);  try_forwarding = true; break;
01438                 case con_res:  internal_consume(tmp);  try_forwarding = true; break;
01439                 case put_item: internal_push(tmp);  try_forwarding = true; break;
01440                 case try_fwd:  internal_forward(tmp); break;
01441                 }
01442             }
01443             if (try_forwarding && !forwarder_busy) {
01444                 forwarder_busy = true;
01445                 task::enqueue(*new(task::allocate_additional_child_of(*my_parent)) internal::forward_task< buffer_node<input_type, A> >(*this));
01446             }
01447         }
01448 
01450         virtual void forward() {
01451             buffer_operation op_data(try_fwd);
01452             do {
01453                 op_data.status = WAIT;
01454                 my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
01455             } while (op_data.status == SUCCEEDED);
01456         }
01457 
01459         virtual void internal_reg_succ(buffer_operation *op) {
01460             my_successors.register_successor(*(op->r));
01461             __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01462         }
01463 
01465         virtual void internal_rem_succ(buffer_operation *op) {
01466             my_successors.remove_successor(*(op->r));
01467             __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01468         }
01469 
01471         virtual void internal_forward(buffer_operation *op) {
01472             T i_copy;
01473             bool success = false; // flagged when a successor accepts
01474             size_type counter = my_successors.size();
01475             // Try forwarding, giving each successor a chance
01476             while (counter>0 && !this->buffer_empty() && this->item_valid(this->my_tail-1)) {
01477                 this->fetch_back(i_copy);
01478                 if( my_successors.try_put(i_copy) ) {
01479                     this->invalidate_back();
01480                     --(this->my_tail);
01481                     success = true; // found an accepting successor
01482                 }
01483                 --counter;
01484             }
01485             if (success && !counter)
01486                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01487             else {
01488                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, FAILED);
01489                 forwarder_busy = false;
01490             }
01491         }
01492 
01493         virtual void internal_push(buffer_operation *op) {
01494             this->push_back(*(op->elem));
01495             __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01496         }
01497 
01498         virtual void internal_pop(buffer_operation *op) {
01499             if(this->pop_back(*(op->elem))) {
01500                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01501             }
01502             else {
01503                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, FAILED);
01504             }
01505         }
01506 
01507         virtual void internal_reserve(buffer_operation *op) {
01508             if(this->reserve_front(*(op->elem))) {
01509                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01510             }
01511             else {
01512                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, FAILED);
01513             }
01514         }
01515 
01516         virtual void internal_consume(buffer_operation *op) {
01517             this->consume_front();
01518             __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01519         }
01520 
01521         virtual void internal_release(buffer_operation *op) {
01522             this->release_front();
01523             __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01524         }
01525 
01526     public:
01528         buffer_node( graph &g ) : reservable_item_buffer<T>(),
01529             my_parent( g.root_task() ), forwarder_busy(false) {
01530             my_successors.set_owner(this);
01531             my_aggregator.initialize_handler(my_handler(this));
01532         }
01533 
01534         virtual ~buffer_node() {}
01535 
01536         //
01537         // message sender implementation
01538         //
01539 
01541 
01542         /* override */ bool register_successor( receiver<output_type> &r ) {
01543             buffer_operation op_data(reg_succ);
01544             op_data.r = &r;
01545             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
01546             return true;
01547         }
01548 
01550 
01552         /* override */ bool remove_successor( receiver<output_type> &r ) {
01553             r.remove_predecessor(*this);
01554             buffer_operation op_data(rem_succ);
01555             op_data.r = &r;
01556             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
01557             return true;
01558         }
01559 
01561 
01563         /* override */ bool try_get( T &v ) {
01564             buffer_operation op_data(req_item);
01565             op_data.elem = &v;
01566             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
01567             return (op_data.status==SUCCEEDED);
01568         }
01569 
01571 
01573         /* override */ bool try_reserve( T &v ) {
01574             buffer_operation op_data(res_item);
01575             op_data.elem = &v;
01576             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
01577             return (op_data.status==SUCCEEDED);
01578         }
01579 
01581 
01582         /* override */ bool try_release() {
01583             buffer_operation op_data(rel_res);
01584             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
01585             return true;
01586         }
01587 
01589 
01590         /* override */ bool try_consume() {
01591             buffer_operation op_data(con_res);
01592             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
01593             return true;
01594         }
01595 
01597 
01598         /* override */ bool try_put(T t) {
01599             buffer_operation op_data(t, put_item);
01600             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
01601             return true;
01602         }
01603     };
01604 
01605 
01607     template <typename T, typename A=cache_aligned_allocator<T> >
01608     class queue_node : public buffer_node<T, A> {
01609     protected:
01610     typedef typename buffer_node<T, A>::size_type size_type;
01611     typedef typename buffer_node<T, A>::buffer_operation queue_operation;
01612 
01613         enum op_stat {WAIT=0, SUCCEEDED, FAILED};
01614 
01616         /* override */ void internal_forward(queue_operation *op) {
01617             T i_copy;
01618             bool success = false; // flagged when a successor accepts
01619             size_type counter = this->my_successors.size();
01620             if (this->my_reserved || !this->item_valid(this->my_head)){
01621                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, FAILED);
01622                 this->forwarder_busy = false;
01623                 return;
01624             }
01625             // Keep trying to send items while there is at least one accepting successor
01626             while (counter>0 && this->item_valid(this->my_head)) {
01627                 this->fetch_front(i_copy);
01628                 if(this->my_successors.try_put(i_copy)) {
01629                      this->invalidate_front();
01630                      ++(this->my_head);
01631                     success = true; // found an accepting successor
01632                 }
01633                 --counter;
01634             }
01635             if (success && !counter)
01636                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01637             else {
01638                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, FAILED);
01639                 this->forwarder_busy = false;
01640             }
01641         }
01642 
01643         /* override */ void internal_pop(queue_operation *op) {
01644             if ( this->my_reserved || !this->item_valid(this->my_head)){
01645                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, FAILED);
01646             }
01647             else {
01648                 this->pop_front(*(op->elem));
01649                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01650             }
01651         }
01652         /* override */ void internal_reserve(queue_operation *op) {
01653             if (this->my_reserved || !this->item_valid(this->my_head)) {
01654                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, FAILED);
01655             }
01656             else {
01657                 this->my_reserved = true;
01658                 this->fetch_front(*(op->elem));
01659                 this->invalidate_front();
01660                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01661             }
01662         }
01663         /* override */ void internal_consume(queue_operation *op) {
01664             this->consume_front();
01665             __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01666         }
01667 
01668     public:
01669 
01670         typedef T input_type;
01671         typedef T output_type;
01672         typedef sender< input_type > predecessor_type;
01673         typedef receiver< output_type > successor_type;
01674 
01676     queue_node( graph &g ) : buffer_node<T, A>(g) {}
01677     };
01678 
01680     template< typename T, typename A=cache_aligned_allocator<T> >
01681     class sequencer_node : public queue_node<T, A> {
01682         internal::function_body< T, size_t > *my_sequencer;
01683     public:
01684 
01685         typedef T input_type;
01686         typedef T output_type;
01687         typedef sender< input_type > predecessor_type;
01688         typedef receiver< output_type > successor_type;
01689 
01691         template< typename Sequencer >
01692         sequencer_node( graph &g, const Sequencer& s ) : queue_node<T, A>(g),
01693             my_sequencer(new internal::function_body_leaf< T, size_t, Sequencer>(s) ) {}
01694 
01696         ~sequencer_node() { delete my_sequencer; }
01697     protected:
01698         typedef typename buffer_node<T, A>::size_type size_type;
01699         typedef typename buffer_node<T, A>::buffer_operation sequencer_operation;
01700 
01701         enum op_stat {WAIT=0, SUCCEEDED, FAILED};
01702 
01703     private:
01704         /* override */ void internal_push(sequencer_operation *op) {
01705             size_type tag = (*my_sequencer)(*(op->elem));
01706 
01707             this->my_tail = (tag+1 > this->my_tail) ? tag+1 : this->my_tail;
01708 
01709             if(this->size() > this->capacity())
01710                 this->grow_my_array(this->size());  // tail already has 1 added to it
01711             this->item(tag) = std::make_pair( *(op->elem), true );
01712             __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01713         }
01714     };
01715 
01717     template< typename T, typename Compare = std::less<T>, typename A=cache_aligned_allocator<T> >
01718     class priority_queue_node : public buffer_node<T, A> {
01719     public:
01720         typedef T input_type;
01721         typedef T output_type;
01722         typedef sender< input_type > predecessor_type;
01723         typedef receiver< output_type > successor_type;
01724 
01726     priority_queue_node( graph &g ) : buffer_node<T, A>(g), mark(0) {}
01727 
01728     protected:
01729         typedef typename buffer_node<T, A>::size_type size_type;
01730         typedef typename buffer_node<T, A>::item_type item_type;
01731         typedef typename buffer_node<T, A>::buffer_operation prio_operation;
01732 
01733         enum op_stat {WAIT=0, SUCCEEDED, FAILED};
01734 
01735         /* override */ void handle_operations(prio_operation *op_list) {
01736             prio_operation *tmp /*, *pop_list*/ ;
01737             bool try_forwarding=false;
01738             while (op_list) {
01739                 tmp = op_list;
01740                 op_list = op_list->next;
01741                 switch (tmp->type) {
01742                 case buffer_node<T, A>::reg_succ: this->internal_reg_succ(tmp); try_forwarding = true; break;
01743                 case buffer_node<T, A>::rem_succ: this->internal_rem_succ(tmp); break;
01744                 case buffer_node<T, A>::put_item: internal_push(tmp); try_forwarding = true; break;
01745                 case buffer_node<T, A>::try_fwd: internal_forward(tmp); break;
01746                 case buffer_node<T, A>::rel_res: internal_release(tmp); try_forwarding = true; break;
01747                 case buffer_node<T, A>::con_res: internal_consume(tmp); try_forwarding = true; break;
01748                 case buffer_node<T, A>::req_item: internal_pop(tmp); break;
01749                 case buffer_node<T, A>::res_item: internal_reserve(tmp); break;
01750                 }
01751             }
01752             // process pops!  for now, no special pop processing
01753             if (mark<this->my_tail) heapify();
01754             if (try_forwarding && !this->forwarder_busy) {
01755                 this->forwarder_busy = true;
01756                 task::enqueue(*new(task::allocate_additional_child_of(*(this->my_parent))) internal::forward_task< buffer_node<input_type, A> >(*this));
01757             }
01758         }
01759 
01761         /* override */ void internal_forward(prio_operation *op) {
01762             T i_copy;
01763             bool success = false; // flagged when a successor accepts
01764             size_type counter = this->my_successors.size();
01765 
01766             if (this->my_reserved || this->my_tail == 0) {
01767                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, FAILED);
01768                 this->forwarder_busy = false;
01769                 return;
01770             }
01771             // Keep trying to send while there exists an accepting successor
01772             while (counter>0 && this->my_tail > 0) {
01773                 i_copy = this->my_array[0].first;
01774                 bool msg = this->my_successors.try_put(i_copy);
01775                 if ( msg == true ) {
01776                      if (mark == this->my_tail) --mark;
01777                     --(this->my_tail);
01778                     this->my_array[0].first=this->my_array[this->my_tail].first;
01779                     if (this->my_tail > 1) // don't reheap for heap of size 1
01780                         reheap();
01781                     success = true; // found an accepting successor
01782                 }
01783                 --counter;
01784             }
01785             if (success && !counter)
01786                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01787             else {
01788                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, FAILED);
01789                 this->forwarder_busy = false;
01790             }
01791         }
01792 
01793         /* override */ void internal_push(prio_operation *op) {
01794             if ( this->my_tail >= this->my_array_size )
01795                 this->grow_my_array( this->my_tail + 1 );
01796             this->my_array[this->my_tail] = std::make_pair( *(op->elem), true );
01797             ++(this->my_tail);
01798             __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01799         }
01800         /* override */ void internal_pop(prio_operation *op) {
01801             if ( this->my_reserved == true || this->my_tail == 0 ) {
01802                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, FAILED);
01803             }
01804             else {
01805                 if (mark<this->my_tail &&
01806                     compare(this->my_array[0].first,
01807                             this->my_array[this->my_tail-1].first)) {
01808                     // there are newly pushed elems; last one higher than top
01809                     // copy the data
01810                     *(op->elem) = this->my_array[this->my_tail-1].first;
01811                     --(this->my_tail);
01812                     __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01813                 }
01814                 else { // extract and push the last element down heap
01815                     *(op->elem) = this->my_array[0].first; // copy the data
01816                     if (mark == this->my_tail) --mark;
01817                     --(this->my_tail);
01818                     __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01819                     this->my_array[0].first=this->my_array[this->my_tail].first;
01820                     if (this->my_tail > 1) // don't reheap for heap of size 1
01821                         reheap();
01822                 }
01823             }
01824         }
01825         /* override */ void internal_reserve(prio_operation *op) {
01826             if (this->my_reserved == true || this->my_tail == 0) {
01827                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, FAILED);
01828             }
01829             else {
01830                 this->my_reserved = true;
01831                 *(op->elem) = reserved_item = this->my_array[0].first;
01832                 if (mark == this->my_tail) --mark;
01833                 --(this->my_tail);
01834                 __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01835                 this->my_array[0].first = this->my_array[this->my_tail].first;
01836                 if (this->my_tail > 1) // don't reheap for heap of size 1
01837                     reheap();
01838             }
01839         }
01840         /* override */ void internal_consume(prio_operation *op) {
01841             this->my_reserved = false;
01842             __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01843         }
01844         /* override */ void internal_release(prio_operation *op) {
01845             if (this->my_tail >= this->my_array_size)
01846                 this->grow_my_array( this->my_tail + 1 );
01847             this->my_array[this->my_tail] = std::make_pair(reserved_item, true);
01848             ++(this->my_tail);
01849             this->my_reserved = false;
01850             __TBB_store_with_release(op->status, SUCCEEDED);
01851             heapify();
01852         }
01853     private:
01854         Compare compare;
01855         size_type mark;
01856         input_type reserved_item;
01857 
01858         void heapify() {
01859             if (!mark) mark = 1;
01860             for (; mark<this->my_tail; ++mark) { // for each unheaped element
01861                 size_type cur_pos = mark;
01862                 input_type to_place = this->my_array[mark].first;
01863                 do { // push to_place up the heap
01864                     size_type parent = (cur_pos-1)>>1;
01865                     if (!compare(this->my_array[parent].first, to_place))
01866                         break;
01867                     this->my_array[cur_pos].first = this->my_array[parent].first;
01868                     cur_pos = parent;
01869                 } while( cur_pos );
01870                 this->my_array[cur_pos].first = to_place;
01871             }
01872         }
01873 
01874         void reheap() {
01875             size_type cur_pos=0, child=1;
01876             while (child < mark) {
01877                 size_type target = child;
01878                 if (child+1<mark &&
01879                     compare(this->my_array[child].first,
01880                             this->my_array[child+1].first))
01881                     ++target;
01882                 // target now has the higher priority child
01883                 if (compare(this->my_array[target].first,
01884                             this->my_array[this->my_tail].first))
01885                     break;
01886                 this->my_array[cur_pos].first = this->my_array[target].first;
01887                 cur_pos = target;
01888                 child = (cur_pos<<1)+1;
01889             }
01890             this->my_array[cur_pos].first = this->my_array[this->my_tail].first;
01891         }
01892     };
01893 
01895 
01898     template< typename T >
01899     class limiter_node : public graph_node, public receiver< T >, public sender< T >, internal::no_copy {
01900     public:
01901 
01902         typedef T input_type;
01903         typedef T output_type;
01904         typedef sender< input_type > predecessor_type;
01905         typedef receiver< output_type > successor_type;
01906 
01907     private:
01908 
01909         task *my_root_task;
01910         size_t my_threshold;
01911         size_t my_count;
01912         internal::predecessor_cache< T > my_predecessors;
01913         spin_mutex my_mutex;
01914         internal::broadcast_cache< T > my_successors;
01915 
01916         friend class internal::forward_task< limiter_node<T> >;
01917 
01918         // Let decrementer call decrement_counter()
01919         friend class internal::decrementer< limiter_node<T> >;
01920 
01921         void decrement_counter() {
01922             input_type v;
01923             
01924             // If we can't get / put an item immediately then drop the count
01925             if ( my_predecessors.get_item( v ) == false 
01926                  || my_successors.try_put(v) == false ) {
01927                 spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(my_mutex);
01928                 --my_count;
01929                 if ( !my_predecessors.empty() ) 
01930                     task::enqueue( * new ( task::allocate_additional_child_of( *my_root_task ) ) 
01931                                 internal::forward_task< limiter_node<T> >( *this ) );
01932             }
01933         }
01934 
01935         void forward() {
01936             {
01937                 spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(my_mutex);
01938                 if ( my_count < my_threshold ) 
01939                     ++my_count;
01940                 else
01941                     return;
01942             }
01943             decrement_counter();
01944         }
01945 
01946     public:
01947 
01949         internal::decrementer< limiter_node<T> > decrement;
01950 
01952         limiter_node( graph &g, size_t threshold, int number_of_decrement_predecessors = 0 ) : 
01953            my_root_task(g.root_task()), my_threshold(threshold), my_count(0), decrement(number_of_decrement_predecessors) {
01954             my_predecessors.set_owner(this);
01955             my_successors.set_owner(this);
01956             decrement.set_owner(this);
01957         }
01958 
01960         /* override */ bool register_successor( receiver<output_type> &r ) {
01961             my_successors.register_successor(r);
01962             return true;
01963         }
01964 
01966 
01967         /* override */ bool remove_successor( receiver<output_type> &r ) {
01968             r.remove_predecessor(*this);
01969             my_successors.remove_successor(r);
01970             return true;
01971         }
01972 
01974         /* override */ bool try_put( T t ) {
01975             {
01976                 spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(my_mutex);
01977                 if ( my_count >= my_threshold ) 
01978                     return false;
01979                 else
01980                     ++my_count; 
01981             }
01982 
01983             bool msg = my_successors.try_put(t);
01984 
01985             if ( msg != true ) {
01986                 spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(my_mutex);
01987                 --my_count;
01988                 if ( !my_predecessors.empty() ) 
01989                     task::enqueue( * new ( task::allocate_additional_child_of( *my_root_task ) ) 
01990                                 internal::forward_task< limiter_node<T> >( *this ) );
01991             }
01992 
01993             return msg;
01994         }
01995 
01997         /* override */ bool register_predecessor( predecessor_type &src ) {
01998             spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(my_mutex);
01999             my_predecessors.add( src );
02000             if ( my_count < my_threshold && !my_successors.empty() ) 
02001                 task::enqueue( * new ( task::allocate_additional_child_of( *my_root_task ) ) 
02002                                internal::forward_task< limiter_node<T> >( *this ) );
02003             return true;
02004         }
02005 
02007         /* override */ bool remove_predecessor( predecessor_type &src ) {
02008             my_predecessors.remove( src );
02009             return true;
02010         }
02011 
02012     };
02013 
02014     namespace internal {
02015 
02016     struct forwarding_base {
02017         forwarding_base(task *rt) : my_root_task(rt) {}
02018         virtual ~forwarding_base() {}
02019         virtual void decrement_port_count() = 0;
02020         virtual void increment_port_count() = 0;
02021         // moved here so input ports can queue tasks
02022         task* my_root_task;
02023     };
02024 
02025     template< int N >
02026     struct join_helper {
02027 
02028         template< typename TupleType, typename PortType >
02029         static inline void set_join_node_pointer(TupleType &my_input, PortType *port) {
02030             std::get<N-1>( my_input ).set_join_node_pointer(port);
02031             join_helper<N-1>::set_join_node_pointer( my_input, port );
02032         }
02033         template< typename TupleType >
02034         static inline void consume_reservations( TupleType &my_input ) {
02035             std::get<N-1>( my_input ).consume();
02036             join_helper<N-1>::consume_reservations( my_input );
02037         }
02038 
02039         template< typename TupleType >
02040         static inline void release_my_reservation( TupleType &my_input ) {
02041             std::get<N-1>( my_input ).release();
02042         }
02043 
02044         template <typename TupleType>
02045         static inline void release_reservations( TupleType &my_input) {
02046             join_helper<N-1>::release_reservations(my_input);
02047             release_my_reservation(my_input);
02048         }
02049 
02050         template< typename InputTuple, typename OutputTuple >
02051         static inline bool reserve( InputTuple &my_input, OutputTuple &out) {
02052             if ( !std::get<N-1>( my_input ).reserve( std::get<N-1>( out ) ) ) return false;
02053             if ( !join_helper<N-1>::reserve( my_input, out ) ) {
02054                 release_my_reservation( my_input );
02055                 return false;
02056             }
02057             return true;
02058         }
02059 
02060         template<typename InputTuple, typename OutputTuple>
02061         static inline bool get_my_item( InputTuple &my_input, OutputTuple &out) {
02062             bool res = std::get<N-1>(my_input).get_item(std::get<N-1>(out) ); // may fail
02063             return join_helper<N-1>::get_my_item(my_input, out) && res;       // do get on other inputs before returning
02064         }
02065 
02066         template<typename InputTuple, typename OutputTuple>
02067         static inline bool get_items(InputTuple &my_input, OutputTuple &out) {
02068             return get_my_item(my_input, out);
02069         }
02070 
02071         template<typename InputTuple>
02072         static inline void reset_my_port(InputTuple &my_input) {
02073             join_helper<N-1>::reset_my_port(my_input);
02074             std::get<N-1>(my_input).reset_port();
02075         }
02076 
02077         template<typename InputTuple>
02078         static inline void reset_ports(InputTuple& my_input) {
02079             reset_my_port(my_input);
02080         }
02081     };
02082 
02083     template< >
02084     struct join_helper<1> {
02085 
02086         template< typename TupleType, typename PortType >
02087         static inline void set_join_node_pointer(TupleType &my_input, PortType *port) {
02088             std::get<0>( my_input ).set_join_node_pointer(port);
02089         }
02090 
02091         template< typename TupleType >
02092         static inline void consume_reservations( TupleType &my_input ) {
02093             std::get<0>( my_input ).consume();
02094         }
02095 
02096         template< typename TupleType >
02097         static inline void release_my_reservation( TupleType &my_input ) {
02098             std::get<0>( my_input ).release();
02099         }
02100         
02101         template<typename TupleType>
02102         static inline void release_reservations( TupleType &my_input) {
02103             release_my_reservation(my_input);
02104         }
02105 
02106         template< typename InputTuple, typename OutputTuple >
02107         static inline bool reserve( InputTuple &my_input, OutputTuple &out) {
02108             return std::get<0>( my_input ).reserve( std::get<0>( out ) );
02109         }
02110 
02111         template<typename InputTuple, typename OutputTuple>
02112         static inline bool get_my_item( InputTuple &my_input, OutputTuple &out) {
02113             return std::get<0>(my_input).get_item(std::get<0>(out));
02114         }
02115 
02116         template<typename InputTuple, typename OutputTuple>
02117         static inline bool get_items(InputTuple &my_input, OutputTuple &out) {
02118             return get_my_item(my_input, out);
02119         }
02120 
02121         template<typename InputTuple>
02122         static inline void reset_my_port(InputTuple &my_input) {
02123             std::get<0>(my_input).reset_port();
02124         }
02125 
02126         template<typename InputTuple>
02127         static inline void reset_ports(InputTuple& my_input) {
02128             reset_my_port(my_input);
02129         }
02130     };
02131 
02132     namespace join_policy_namespace {
02133         enum join_policy { reserving
02134             , queueing
02135         };
02136     }
02137     using namespace join_policy_namespace;
02138 
02140     template< typename T >
02141     class reserving_port : public receiver<T> {
02142     public:
02143         typedef T input_type;
02144         typedef sender<T> predecessor_type;
02145     private:
02146         // ----------- Aggregator ------------
02147         enum op_type { reg_pred, rem_pred, res_item, rel_res, con_res };
02148         enum op_stat {WAIT=0, SUCCEEDED, FAILED};
02149         typedef reserving_port<T> my_class;
02150 
02151         class reserving_port_operation : public aggregated_operation<reserving_port_operation> {
02152         public:
02153             char type;
02154             union {
02155                 T *my_arg;
02156                 predecessor_type *my_pred;
02157             };
02158             reserving_port_operation(const T& e, op_type t) :
02159                 type(char(t)), my_arg(const_cast<T*>(&e)) {}
02160             reserving_port_operation(const predecessor_type &s, op_type t) : type(char(t)), 
02161                 my_pred(const_cast<predecessor_type *>(&s)) {}
02162             reserving_port_operation(op_type t) : type(char(t)) {}
02163         };
02164 
02165         typedef internal::aggregating_functor<my_class, reserving_port_operation> my_handler;
02166         friend class internal::aggregating_functor<my_class, reserving_port_operation>;
02167         aggregator<my_handler, reserving_port_operation> my_aggregator;
02168 
02169         void handle_operations(reserving_port_operation* op_list) {
02170             reserving_port_operation *current;
02171             bool no_predecessors;
02172             while(op_list) {
02173                 current = op_list;
02174                 op_list = op_list->next;
02175                 switch(current->type) {
02176                 case reg_pred:
02177                     no_predecessors = my_predecessors.empty();
02178                     my_predecessors.add(*(current->my_pred));
02179                     if ( no_predecessors ) {
02180                         my_join->decrement_port_count( ); // may try to forward
02181                     }
02182                     __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, SUCCEEDED);
02183                     break;
02184                 case rem_pred:
02185                     my_predecessors.remove(*(current->my_pred));
02186                     if(my_predecessors.empty()) my_join->increment_port_count();
02187                     __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, SUCCEEDED);
02188                     break;
02189                 case res_item:
02190                     if ( reserved ) {
02191                         __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, FAILED);
02192                     }
02193                     else if ( my_predecessors.try_reserve( *(current->my_arg) ) ) {
02194                         reserved = true;
02195                         __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, SUCCEEDED);
02196                     } else {
02197                         if ( my_predecessors.empty() ) {
02198                             my_join->increment_port_count();
02199                         }
02200                         __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, FAILED);
02201                     }
02202                     break;
02203                 case rel_res:
02204                     reserved = false;
02205                     my_predecessors.try_release( );
02206                     __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, SUCCEEDED);
02207                     break;
02208                 case con_res:
02209                     reserved = false;
02210                     my_predecessors.try_consume( );
02211                     __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, SUCCEEDED);
02212                     break;
02213                 }
02214             }
02215         }
02216 
02217     public:
02218 
02220         reserving_port() : reserved(false) {
02221             my_join = NULL;
02222             my_predecessors.set_owner( this );
02223             my_aggregator.initialize_handler(my_handler(this));
02224         }
02225 
02226         // copy constructor
02227         reserving_port(const reserving_port& /* other */) : receiver<T>() {
02228             reserved = false;
02229             my_join = NULL;
02230             my_predecessors.set_owner( this );
02231             my_aggregator.initialize_handler(my_handler(this));
02232         }
02233 
02234         void set_join_node_pointer(forwarding_base *join) {
02235             my_join = join;
02236         }
02237 
02238         // always rejects, so arc is reversed (and reserves can be done.)
02239         bool try_put( T ) {
02240             return false;
02241         }
02242 
02244         bool register_predecessor( sender<T> &src ) {
02245             reserving_port_operation op_data(src, reg_pred);
02246             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
02247             return op_data.status == SUCCEEDED;
02248         }
02249 
02251         bool remove_predecessor( sender<T> &src ) {
02252             reserving_port_operation op_data(src, rem_pred);
02253             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
02254             return op_data.status == SUCCEEDED;
02255         }
02256 
02258         bool reserve( T &v ) {
02259             reserving_port_operation op_data(v, res_item);
02260             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
02261             return op_data.status == SUCCEEDED;
02262         }
02263 
02265         void release( ) {
02266             reserving_port_operation op_data(rel_res);
02267             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
02268         }
02269 
02271         void consume( ) {
02272             reserving_port_operation op_data(con_res);
02273             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
02274         }
02275 
02276     private:
02277         forwarding_base *my_join;
02278         reservable_predecessor_cache< T, null_mutex > my_predecessors;
02279         bool reserved;
02280     };
02281 
02283     template<typename T>
02284     class queueing_port : public receiver<T>, public item_buffer<T> {
02285     public:
02286         typedef T input_type;
02287         typedef sender<T> predecessor_type;
02288         typedef queueing_port<T> my_node_type;
02289 
02290 // ----------- Aggregator ------------
02291     private:
02292         enum op_type { try__put, get__item, res_port };
02293         enum op_stat {WAIT=0, SUCCEEDED, FAILED};
02294         typedef queueing_port<T> my_class;
02295 
02296         class queueing_port_operation : public aggregated_operation<queueing_port_operation> {
02297         public:
02298             char type;
02299             union {
02300                 T my_val;
02301                 T *my_arg;
02302             };
02303             // constructor for value parameter
02304             queueing_port_operation(const T& e, op_type t) :
02305                 // type(char(t)), my_val(const_cast<T>(e)) {}
02306                 type(char(t)), my_val(e) {}
02307             // constructor for pointer parameter
02308             queueing_port_operation(const T* p, op_type t) :
02309                 type(char(t)), my_arg(const_cast<T*>(p)) {}
02310             // constructor with no parameter
02311             queueing_port_operation(op_type t) : type(char(t)) {}
02312         };
02313 
02314         typedef internal::aggregating_functor<my_class, queueing_port_operation> my_handler;
02315         friend class internal::aggregating_functor<my_class, queueing_port_operation>;
02316         aggregator<my_handler, queueing_port_operation> my_aggregator;
02317 
02318         void handle_operations(queueing_port_operation* op_list) {
02319             queueing_port_operation *current;
02320             bool was_empty;
02321             while(op_list) {
02322                 current = op_list;
02323                 op_list = op_list->next;
02324                 switch(current->type) {
02325                 case try__put:
02326                     was_empty = this->buffer_empty();
02327                     this->push_back(current->my_val);
02328                     if (was_empty) my_join->decrement_port_count();
02329                     __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, SUCCEEDED);
02330                     break;
02331                 case get__item:
02332                     if(!this->buffer_empty()) {
02333                         this->fetch_front(*(current->my_arg));
02334                         __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, SUCCEEDED);
02335                     }
02336                     else {
02337                         __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, FAILED);
02338                     }
02339                     break;
02340                 case res_port:
02341                     __TBB_ASSERT(this->item_valid(this->my_head), "No item to reset");
02342                     this->invalidate_front(); ++(this->my_head);
02343                     if(this->item_valid(this->my_head)) {
02344                         my_join->decrement_port_count();
02345                     }
02346                     __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, SUCCEEDED);
02347                     break;
02348                 }
02349             }
02350         }
02351 // ------------ End Aggregator ---------------
02352     public:
02353 
02355         queueing_port() : item_buffer<T>() {
02356             my_join = NULL;
02357             my_aggregator.initialize_handler(my_handler(this));
02358         }
02359 
02361         queueing_port(const queueing_port& /* other */) : receiver<T>(), item_buffer<T>() {
02362             my_join = NULL;
02363             my_aggregator.initialize_handler(my_handler(this));
02364         }
02365 
02367         void set_join_node_pointer(forwarding_base *join) {
02368             my_join = join;
02369         }
02370 
02371         /*override*/bool try_put(T v) {
02372             queueing_port_operation op_data(v, try__put);
02373             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
02374             return op_data.status == SUCCEEDED;
02375         }
02376 
02377 
02378         bool get_item( T &v ) {
02379             queueing_port_operation op_data(&v, get__item);
02380             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
02381             return op_data.status == SUCCEEDED;
02382         }
02383 
02384         // reset_port is called when item is accepted by successor, but
02385         // is initiated by join_node.
02386         void reset_port() {
02387             queueing_port_operation op_data(res_port);
02388             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
02389             return;
02390         }
02391 
02392     private:
02393         forwarding_base *my_join;
02394     };
02395 
02396     template<join_policy JP, typename InputTuple, typename OutputTuple>
02397     class join_node_base;
02398 
02400     template<join_policy JP, typename InputTuple, typename OutputTuple>
02401     class join_node_FE;
02402 
02403     template<typename InputTuple, typename OutputTuple>
02404     class join_node_FE<reserving, InputTuple, OutputTuple> : public forwarding_base {
02405     public:
02406         static const int N = std::tuple_size<OutputTuple>::value;
02407         typedef OutputTuple output_type;
02408         typedef InputTuple input_type;
02409         typedef join_node_base<reserving, InputTuple, OutputTuple> my_node_type; // for forwarding
02410 
02411         join_node_FE(graph &g) : forwarding_base(g.root_task()), my_node(NULL) {
02412             ports_with_no_inputs = N;
02413             join_helper<N>::set_join_node_pointer(my_inputs, this);
02414         }
02415 
02416         void set_my_node(my_node_type *new_my_node) { my_node = new_my_node; }
02417 
02418        void increment_port_count() {
02419             ++ports_with_no_inputs;
02420         }
02421 
02422         // if all input_ports have predecessors, spawn forward to try and consume tuples
02423         void decrement_port_count() {
02424             if(ports_with_no_inputs.fetch_and_decrement() == 1) {
02425                 task::enqueue( * new ( task::allocate_additional_child_of( *(this->my_root_task) ) )
02426                     forward_task<my_node_type>(*my_node) );
02427             }
02428         }
02429 
02430         input_type &inputs() { return my_inputs; }
02431     protected:
02432         // all methods on input ports should be called under mutual exclusion from join_node_base.
02433 
02434         bool tuple_build_may_succeed() {
02435             return !ports_with_no_inputs;
02436         }
02437 
02438         bool try_to_make_tuple(output_type &out) {
02439             if(ports_with_no_inputs) return false;
02440             return join_helper<N>::reserve(my_inputs, out);
02441         }
02442 
02443         void tuple_accepted() {
02444             join_helper<N>::consume_reservations(my_inputs);
02445         }
02446         void tuple_rejected() {
02447             join_helper<N>::release_reservations(my_inputs);
02448         }
02449 
02450         input_type my_inputs;
02451         my_node_type *my_node;
02452         atomic<size_t> ports_with_no_inputs;
02453     };
02454 
02455     template<typename InputTuple, typename OutputTuple>
02456     class join_node_FE<queueing, InputTuple, OutputTuple> : public forwarding_base {
02457     public:
02458         static const int N = std::tuple_size<OutputTuple>::value;
02459         typedef OutputTuple output_type;
02460         typedef InputTuple input_type;
02461         typedef join_node_base<queueing, InputTuple, OutputTuple> my_node_type; // for forwarding
02462 
02463         join_node_FE(graph &g) : forwarding_base(g.root_task()), my_node(NULL) {
02464             ports_with_no_items = N;
02465             join_helper<N>::set_join_node_pointer(my_inputs, this);
02466         }
02467 
02468         // needed for forwarding
02469         void set_my_node(my_node_type *new_my_node) { my_node = new_my_node; }
02470 
02471         void reset_port_count() {
02472             ports_with_no_items = N;
02473         }
02474 
02475         // if all input_ports have items, spawn forward to try and consume tuples
02476         void decrement_port_count() {
02477             if(ports_with_no_items.fetch_and_decrement() == 1) {
02478                 task::enqueue( * new ( task::allocate_additional_child_of( *(this->my_root_task) ) )
02479                     forward_task<my_node_type>(*my_node) );
02480             }
02481         }
02482 
02483         void increment_port_count() { __TBB_ASSERT(false, NULL); }  // should never be called
02484 
02485         input_type &inputs() { return my_inputs; }
02486     protected:
02487         // all methods on input ports should be called under mutual exclusion from join_node_base.
02488 
02489         bool tuple_build_may_succeed() {
02490             return !ports_with_no_items;
02491         }
02492 
02493         bool try_to_make_tuple(output_type &out) {
02494             if(ports_with_no_items) return false;
02495             return join_helper<N>::get_items(my_inputs, out);
02496         }
02497 
02498         void tuple_accepted() {
02499             reset_port_count();
02500             join_helper<N>::reset_ports(my_inputs);
02501         }
02502         void tuple_rejected() {
02503             // nothing to do.
02504         }
02505 
02506         input_type my_inputs;
02507         my_node_type *my_node;
02508         atomic<size_t> ports_with_no_items;
02509     };
02510 
02512     template<join_policy JP, typename InputTuple, typename OutputTuple>
02513     class join_node_base : public graph_node, public join_node_FE<JP, InputTuple, OutputTuple>,
02514                            public sender<OutputTuple>, no_copy {
02515     public:
02516         typedef OutputTuple output_type;
02517 
02518         typedef receiver<output_type> successor_type;
02519         typedef join_node_FE<JP, InputTuple, OutputTuple> input_ports_type;
02520         using input_ports_type::tuple_build_may_succeed;
02521         using input_ports_type::try_to_make_tuple;
02522         using input_ports_type::tuple_accepted;
02523         using input_ports_type::tuple_rejected;
02524 
02525     private:
02526         // ----------- Aggregator ------------
02527         enum op_type { reg_succ, rem_succ, try__get, do_fwrd };
02528         enum op_stat {WAIT=0, SUCCEEDED, FAILED};
02529         typedef join_node_base<JP,InputTuple,OutputTuple> my_class;
02530 
02531         class join_node_base_operation : public aggregated_operation<join_node_base_operation> {
02532         public:
02533             char type;
02534             union {
02535                 output_type *my_arg;
02536                 successor_type *my_succ;
02537             };
02538             join_node_base_operation(const output_type& e, op_type t) :
02539                 type(char(t)), my_arg(const_cast<output_type*>(&e)) {}
02540             join_node_base_operation(const successor_type &s, op_type t) : type(char(t)), 
02541                 my_succ(const_cast<successor_type *>(&s)) {}
02542             join_node_base_operation(op_type t) : type(char(t)) {}
02543         };
02544 
02545         typedef internal::aggregating_functor<my_class, join_node_base_operation> my_handler;
02546         friend class internal::aggregating_functor<my_class, join_node_base_operation>;
02547         bool forwarder_busy;
02548         aggregator<my_handler, join_node_base_operation> my_aggregator;
02549 
02550         void handle_operations(join_node_base_operation* op_list) {
02551             join_node_base_operation *current;
02552             while(op_list) {
02553                 current = op_list;
02554                 op_list = op_list->next;
02555                 switch(current->type) {
02556                 case reg_succ:
02557                     my_successors.register_successor(*(current->my_succ));
02558                     if(tuple_build_may_succeed() && !forwarder_busy) {
02559                         task::enqueue( * new ( task::allocate_additional_child_of(*(this->my_root_task)) )
02560                                 forward_task<join_node_base<JP,InputTuple,OutputTuple> >(*this));
02561                         forwarder_busy = true;
02562                     }
02563                     __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, SUCCEEDED);
02564                     break;
02565                 case rem_succ:
02566                     my_successors.remove_successor(*(current->my_succ));
02567                     __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, SUCCEEDED);
02568                     break;
02569                 case try__get:
02570                     if(tuple_build_may_succeed()) {
02571                         if(try_to_make_tuple(*(current->my_arg))) {
02572                             tuple_accepted();
02573                             __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, SUCCEEDED);
02574                         }
02575                         else __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, FAILED);
02576                     }
02577                     else __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, FAILED);
02578                     break;
02579                 case do_fwrd: {
02580                         bool build_succeeded;
02581                         output_type out;
02582                         if(tuple_build_may_succeed()) {
02583                             do {
02584                                 build_succeeded = try_to_make_tuple(out);
02585                                 if(build_succeeded) {
02586                                     if(my_successors.try_put(out)) {
02587                                         tuple_accepted();
02588                                     }
02589                                     else {
02590                                         tuple_rejected();
02591                                         build_succeeded = false;
02592                                     }
02593                                 }
02594                             } while(build_succeeded);
02595                         }
02596                         __TBB_store_with_release(current->status, SUCCEEDED);
02597                         forwarder_busy = false;
02598                     }
02599                     break;
02600                 }
02601             }
02602         }
02603         // ---------- end aggregator -----------
02604     public:
02605 
02606         join_node_base(graph &g) : input_ports_type(g), forwarder_busy(false) {
02607             my_successors.set_owner(this);
02608             input_ports_type::set_my_node(this);
02609             my_aggregator.initialize_handler(my_handler(this));
02610         }
02611 
02612         bool register_successor(successor_type &r) {
02613             join_node_base_operation op_data(r, reg_succ);
02614             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
02615             return op_data.status == SUCCEEDED;
02616         }
02617 
02618         bool remove_successor( successor_type &r) {
02619             join_node_base_operation op_data(r, rem_succ);
02620             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
02621             return op_data.status == SUCCEEDED;
02622         }
02623 
02624         bool try_get( output_type &v) {
02625             join_node_base_operation op_data(v, try__get);
02626             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
02627             return op_data.status == SUCCEEDED;
02628         }
02629 
02630     private:
02631         broadcast_cache<output_type, null_rw_mutex> my_successors;
02632 
02633         friend class forward_task< join_node_base<JP, InputTuple, OutputTuple> >;
02634 
02635         void forward() {
02636             join_node_base_operation op_data(do_fwrd);
02637             my_aggregator.execute(&op_data);
02638         }
02639     };
02640 
02642     //  using tuple_element.
02643     template<int N, typename OutputTuple, join_policy JP>
02644     class unfolded_join_node;
02645 
02646     template<typename OutputTuple>
02647     class unfolded_join_node<2,OutputTuple,reserving> : public internal::join_node_base<reserving,
02648         std::tuple<
02649                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<0,OutputTuple>::type>, 
02650                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<1,OutputTuple>::type> >,
02651         OutputTuple
02652                   >
02653                   {
02654     public:
02655         typedef typename std::tuple<
02656                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<0,OutputTuple>::type>, 
02657                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<1,OutputTuple>::type> > input_ports_tuple_type;
02658         typedef OutputTuple output_type;
02659     private:
02660         typedef join_node_base<reserving, input_ports_tuple_type, output_type > base_type;
02661     public:
02662         unfolded_join_node(graph &g) : base_type(g) {}
02663     };
02664

02669                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<1,OutputTuple>::type>,
02670                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<2,OutputTuple>::type> >,
02671         OutputTuple
02672                     >
02673                     {

02678                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<2,OutputTuple>::type> > input_ports_tuple_type;

02686     template<typename OutputTuple>

02688         std::tuple<
02689                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<0,OutputTuple>::type>,
02690                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<1,OutputTuple>::type>,
02691                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<2,OutputTuple>::type>,
02692                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<3,OutputTuple>::type> >,
02693         OutputTuple
02694                     > {
02695     public:
02696         typedef typename std::tuple<
02697                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<0,OutputTuple>::type>, 
02698                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<1,OutputTuple>::type>, 
02699                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<2,OutputTuple>::type>, 
02700                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<3,OutputTuple>::type> > input_ports_tuple_type;
02701         typedef OutputTuple output_type;
02702     private:
02703         typedef join_node_base<reserving, input_ports_tuple_type, output_type > base_type;
02704     public:

02707 
02708     template<typename OutputTuple>
02709     class unfolded_join_node<5,OutputTuple,reserving> : public internal::join_node_base<reserving,
02710         std::tuple<
02711                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<0,OutputTuple>::type>,
02712                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<1,OutputTuple>::type>,
02713                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<2,OutputTuple>::type>,
02714                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<3,OutputTuple>::type>,
02715                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<4,OutputTuple>::type> >,
02716         OutputTuple
02717                 > {
02718     public:
02719         typedef typename std::tuple<
02720                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<0,OutputTuple>::type>, 
02721                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<1,OutputTuple>::type>, 
02722                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<2,OutputTuple>::type>, 
02723                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<3,OutputTuple>::type>, 
02724                 reserving_port<typename std::tuple_element<4,OutputTuple>::type> > input_ports_tuple_type;
02725         typedef OutputTuple output_type;
02726     private:

03117 
03119     template<size_t N, typename JNT>
03120     typename std::tuple_element<N, typename JNT::input_ports_tuple_type>::type &input_port(JNT &jn) {
03121         return std::get<N>(jn.inputs());
03122     }
03123 
03124     } // namespace internal
03125 
03126 using namespace internal::join_policy_namespace;
03127 using internal::input_port;
03128 
03129 template<typename OutputTuple, join_policy JP=reserving>
03130 class join_node: public internal::unfolded_join_node<std::tuple_size<OutputTuple>::value, OutputTuple, JP> {
03131 private:
03132     static const int N = std::tuple_size<OutputTuple>::value;
03133     typedef typename internal::unfolded_join_node<N, OutputTuple, JP> unfolded_type;
03134 public:
03135     typedef OutputTuple output_type;
03136     typedef typename unfolded_type::input_ports_tuple_type input_ports_tuple_type;
03137     join_node(graph &g) : unfolded_type(g) { }
03138 };
03139 
03140     //
03141     // Making edges
03142     //
03143   
03145     template< typename T >
03146     inline void make_edge( sender<T> &p, receiver<T> &s ) {
03147         p.register_successor( s );
03148     }
03149 
03151     template< typename T, typename SIterator >
03152     inline void make_edges( sender<T> &p, SIterator s_begin, SIterator s_end ) {
03153         for ( SIterator i = s_begin; i != s_end; ++i ) {
03154             make_edge( p, **i );
03155         }
03156     }
03157 
03159     template< typename T, typename PIterator >
03160     inline void make_edges( PIterator p_begin, PIterator p_end, receiver<T> &s ) {
03161         for ( PIterator i = p_begin; i != p_end; ++i ) {
03162             make_edge( **i, s );
03163         }
03164     }
03165 
03166 }
03167 
03168 #endif
